p: In our equations (see Methods in Supplementary Information), the solar-pump forcing term is introduced as an infra-day (minutes/hours) attenuation factor for the reproductive number R t and modeled by following the sun radiation curves as a function of the Earth's latitude, day of the year, and time of the day. Solar curves ( Figure 1, and onsets of Figure 2 ) are functions of the solar height angle α (complement to the Zenith angle: i.e. α = 90° at local noon) that, in turn, depends on the Earth's latitude ϕ, sun's declination δ, day of the year d, and time of the day h. Solar curves modulate daily with sin(α) and have maximum amplitudes and widths that depend on ϕ, d, and h, as shown in Figure 1, where the R t attenuation factor (1 – ε sin(α)) is plotted as a function of h (see figure's caption for details).
